main event: A large circular object with a fire color and tail was reported in Bryan, Texas on April 2, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of 1/3 of a full moon., The observation lasted between 5 to 15 seconds., Two small trails appeared to drop off from the object., The sighting occurred at 2040 CST., Various conclusions included it possibly being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon.
sighted object: circular object with fire color and tail
